page.title: 02 LOCAL GOVERNMENT
page.content: {East Lindsey District Council This council is situated at Tedder Hall,Manby.There are 60 unpaid councillors representing the people of the district which covers 700 square miles (the second largest in Britain) with a population of 101,000. The Council employs 1,200 people-300 of these at Manby.At Tedder Hall there are many departments such as Finance, Development and Planning,Estate and Surveying,Entertainment and Amenities, Environmental Services and Personnel and Management. The Council has its own printing room and records are kept on micro-film to save space. Under the Youth Training Scheme young people are trained to use computers. It was this Council's problem to bury a dead whale washed up on the beach at Gibraltar Point.
